intro: Microula diffusa, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs. Microula diffusa thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in desert environments and is often found in disturbed or degraded habitats.
